channel.title: New Zealand Programming Contest
channel.description: Recent content on New Zealand Programming Contest

item.title: Contest Registration
item.description: Team registration will again be done through DOMjudge on contest day. You may like to complete a team entry form for each team so they have the details they need for contest day. Reserve places for your teams as shown on this table. Most sites need to know how many teams they are expecting so they can print problem sets, manage labs and budget for refreshments. For the 3 sites that ask team managers to email the site director, please include the number of teams you expect to enter as well as your contact details.

item.title: Contest Registration
item.description: The New Zealand Programming Contest is today, 14:00 to 19:00. Useful Information for Contest Day Local Site Information Links are on this page. Welcome Video Useful for those new to the contest Use this link. DOMjudge judging system Use this link Team Entry Form Form to record information to register your team Practice Contest Link to the Practice Problem Set Contest Documentation Contest rules Registration Guide - School Teams

item.title: Contest categories
item.description: Notes If team members are not in the same category, then the team must enter in the highest category of the members. Entry fees are paid to the site. However, some sites do not charge for entry. Check your site page for details. Entry fees do NOT apply for an on-line contest. Category Description Entry Fee School Team members must all attend a secondary school in New Zealand. This includes a home school.

item.title: About the contest
item.description: The NZPC is an annual contest, usually held in August or September, and open to all programmers in New Zealand. Teams from outside New Zealand may usually enter the SPAR contest (formerly the ANZAC League) which runs at the same time and uses the same problem set. SPAR Categories There are 5 categories under which teams may compete, each category having its own winner. The categories range from school pupils to professional programmers.

OS/Hardware/etc We will use the DOMjudge automated judge system for running the contest.

item.description: The contest this year was held entirely online because of the outbreak of the Delta Variant of Covid-19.
